noun.description: A rectangular key fitting into grooves in the hub and shaft of a wheel, especially one formed integrally with the shaft which allows movement of the wheel on the shaft.
A continuous curve constructed so as to pass through a given set of points and have a certain number of continuous derivatives.

verb.description: Secure (a part) by means of a spline.

origin: Mid 18th century (originally East Anglian dialect): perhaps related to splinter.
